info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 3:00PM EDT until July 12 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR TUCKER AND SOUTHERN PRESTON COUNTIES... At 259 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Davis, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Davis, Thomas, Rowlesburg, Hendricks, Hambleton, Hannahsville, Elk, Canaan Valley State Park, Pheasant Run, Aurora, and Davisville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm has produced widespread wind damage across Preston County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
